rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
Windows To Go is a planned feature in [[Windows 8]] that will allow the entire system to run from a [[USB flash drive]] or external [[Hard disk drive#External removable drives|USB Hard Drive]].
Windows To Go is a planned feature in [[Windows 8]] that will allow the entire system to run from a [[USB flash drive]] or external [[Hard disk drive#External removable drives|USB Hard Drive]].
  +   +
==History==
  +
In April, 2011, after the leak of Windows 8 build 7850<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/13/windows-8-leaked-caught-looking-a-lot-like-windows-7/</ref>, some noticed that those builds included a program called "Portable Workspace Creator", indicating it was intended to create bootable USB drives of Windows 8.<ref>http://www.winrumors.com/windows-8-portable-workspace-allows-you-to-run-windows-from-a-usb-device/</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/15/windows-8-to-feature-usb-runnable-portable-workspaces-sales-of/</ref>
